last_episode_to_air.name: It Ain't Over 'Til It's Overboard
last_episode_to_air.overview: Marty Lagina joins Kevin and his team as they battle the elements and take one final shot at finding 140 million dollars of Confederate gold at the bottom of Lake Michigan.

name: The Curse of Civil War Gold
original_name: The Curse of Civil War Gold
overview: A deathbed confession made by a lighthouse keeper in the 1890s leads Kevin Dykstra and his team to believe there is Civil War gold to be found in Michigan.

episodes.name: Betrayal
episodes.overview: Treasure hunter Marty Lagina learns of a mystery that rivals Oak Island when he meets fellow Michigan native Kevin Dykstra. Kevin believes he’s found a trail to a fortune in confederate gold that lies at the bottom of Lake Michigan. But he needs Marty’s help to get it.

episodes.name: Right on Track
episodes.overview: Evidence of a possible forgotten railroad energizes Kevin and his team as the pressure builds to convince Marty Lagina to join their quest in the recovery Civil War gold.

episodes.name: In Plain Sight
episodes.overview: The team unearths evidence of a secret tunnel while new clues suggest a deeper mystery than just the missing Confederate gold.

episodes.name: The Utah Connection
episodes.overview: With only one shot left to convince Marty to join their search, the team heads west where new clues are revealed.

episodes.name: The Return
episodes.overview: Alex Lagina joins Kevin Dykstra and his team back on the lake, and new evidence suggests they may have found the gold.

episodes.name: Tunnel Visions
episodes.overview: A diving operation produces potential evidence of some $140 million in gold at the bottom of Lake Michigan, while an informant shares a 50-year-old secret that shocks and energizes the team.

episodes.name: A Void at All Cost
episodes.overview: The team uncovers evidence of a web of tunnels connecting the homes of key players in Kevin's theory, offering possible proof that members of the 4th Michigan Cavalry returned home with millions in Confederate gold.

episodes.name: The Pritchard Connection
episodes.overview: Excitement builds when Kevin and the team uncover evidence on the property of a Civil War general that could convince Marty their theory is legitimate.

episodes.name: Southern Comfort
episodes.overview: A century old family's secret lures Kevin and the team back to Georgia where new finds suggest there's more Civil War gold to be discovered.

episodes.name: Route Awakenings
episodes.overview: Shocking new evidence suggests the plot to steal 140 million dollars in Confederate gold may have been tied to the highest office in the land, and dangerous waters threaten the team’s attempt to investigate a sunken boxcar.

episodes.name: The Plot Thickens
episodes.overview: A theory suggests the theft of Confederate gold funded one of the most nefarious crimes in history.

episodes.name: Grave Expectations
episodes.overview: Excitement soars when Kevin finally holds gold brought home from the arrest of Jefferson Davis, convincing him that his theory is true.

episodes.name: Debris Field of Dreams
episodes.overview: For Kevin Dykstra and his team, an eight-year quest to find a legendary boxcar at the bottom of Lake Michigan becomes a battle against nature itself.

episodes.name: It Ain't Over 'Til It's Overboard
episodes.overview: Marty Lagina joins Kevin and his team as they battle the elements and take one final shot at finding 140 million dollars of Confederate gold at the bottom of Lake Michigan.
